title: Upgrade from 2.13.3.Final breaks aws-lambda-rest with sam jvm integration
body:
### Describe the bug

When upgrading from 2.13.3.Final both to 2.13.4.Final and 2.14.0.Final
and following https://quarkus.io/guides/amazon-lambda-http guide and choosing 
`mvn archetype:generate \
       -DarchetypeGroupId=io.quarkus \
       -DarchetypeArtifactId=quarkus-amazon-lambda-rest-archetype \
       -DarchetypeVersion=2.14.0.Final`

When performing 
`sam local start-api --template target/sam.jvm.yaml`
and then going to 
`http://127.0.0.1:3000/hello`

The console of sam is saying that the function is timed-out and no response got from lambda.
Simply putting version 2.13.3.Final back makes everything work again.


### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

19.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 19.6.0: Tue Jun 21 21:18:39 PDT 2022; root:xnu-6153.141.66~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.12" 2021-07-20 LTS OpenJDK Runtime Environment Corretto-11.0.12.7.2 (build 11.0.12+7-LTS) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Corretto-11.0.12.7.2 (build 11.0.12+7-LTS, mixed mode)
